slides.script: I forgot my best friend's birthday...for the 3rd year in a row. I felt like the worst friend ever. My mind was so foggy, I could barely keep track of what day it was anymore.
slides.image_prompt: Stressed woman sitting at desk with head in hands, calendar with missed birthdays circled in red, ultra photorealistic, 16k, natural lighting, HDR, high resolution, shot on Canon EOS R5, Canon RF 50mm f/1.2L USM, depth of field, --s 750, 9:16 vertical format

slides.script: Turns out, I wasn't alone. My sister told me she kept losing her keys and walking into rooms forgetting why she was there. We laughed it off as "mom brain" but deep down, I was worried.

slides.script: What doctors don't tell you is that chronic stress can literally shrink your brain. While I was struggling to focus at work, my body was secretly sabotaging my mental clarity.

slides.script: Turns out, ashwagandha has been used for centuries in Ayurvedic medicine to reduce stress and sharpen focus. It's even been shown in studies to improve memory and reaction times. I was shocked I'd never heard of it before.
